episode_summary: This episode features four guest comedians from the Edinburgh Fringe Festival, each presenting a unique fact. The topics range from a famous clown teacher's harsh feedback, a philosophical rivalry, the origins of punk music, to Andrew Carnegie's attempt at world peace through dinosaur diplomacy.

facts.fact: The great clown teacher, Philip Golia, is so known for his negative feedback that his former students created a Facebook page purely to log all the many ways he's insulted them. The page is called, Philip Golia hit me with a stick.
In the 1820s, philosopher Arthur Schopenhauer hated his contemporary Hagel so much he intentionally scheduled his lectures at the same time as Hagel's and had zero people attend.
The first band to call themselves punk didn't use guitars.
Andrew Carnegie tried to achieve world peace by sending countries dinosaurs.
